Rothbard certainly managed to hog the spotlight and convince outsiders that he was the major theorist of libertarianism, but his appeal was far more limited than Rand’s. Furthermore Rothbard’s extremism and poor strategic thinking did much to damage the movement and the Libertarian Party.
